channel.title: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?
channel.description: Hey, guys, do you have the experience of running your daily used apps off a USB drive? Which is I am now trying to do. But I find that only portable apps can be run like that. while some apps like MS office are not portably available. How can I do that?

item.title: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

It doesn’t really matter which Office suite you have, they are all basically the same with minor tweaks added in each version. I guess the only major difference between 2003 and 2007/2010 is the ribbon feature that allows you to find icons easier even though they weren’t that hard to find previously.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?

item.title: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?
item.dc:creator: @wonkotheinsane wonkotheinsane
item.description:
@wonkotheinsane wrote:

Hi, I know portableapps but I am looking for what works for MS Office.

Just stumbled upon Prayaya. I installed prayaya on my USB drive and then installed MS Office 2003 suite on prayaya. It seems working very well off my USB drive.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?

item.title: Do you know how to run apps off an iPod or a USB drive?

item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

You download the portable version of the app. There is a portable version of office, look harder.
